comment.author: 23103743@N05
comment._content: See www.statemaster.com/encyclopedia/SMS-Moltke-(1910) "She was the first and only German capital ship to ever visit the United States. On May 11, 1912 she left Kiel, accompanied by light cruisers SMS Stettin and SMS Bremen, and arrived off Hampton Roads, Virginia, on May 30, 1912. After touring the East Coast for two weeks, she returned to Kiel on June 24." NYT of June 10, 1912 query.nytimes.com/gst/abstract.html?res=9C05E3D7153CE633A... places the ship in New York and the visit of the committee on June 9, 1912

comment.author: 54904823@N00
comment._content: en.wikipedia.org/wiki/R.A.C._Smith Robert A.C. Smith (February 22, 1857 - July 27, 1933) was the Commissioner of Docks in New York City.

comment._content: Thanks.  We'll add a note here about Smith next time we update the description.
